text.name: console_notes
text.text:
WonderSwan Color (ワンダースワンカラー, WandāSuwan Karā) Is a Japanese portable console launched by Bandai on December 30, 2000, a Game Boy Advance competitor running 16-bit color games, better or worse than SNES.
In addition to color screen, it has a memory of 512kbit, which allows the creation of more complex games. Bandai has partnered with Square, which has released heavyweight titles such as the remakes of Final Fantasy I, Final Fantasy II and Final Fantasy IV. A new version of WonderSwan called Swan Crystal, which features a liquid crystal display using TFT technology was launched in 2002.
